Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Advanced components not work in vue-router" (#1767) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
Vue-router 2.7.0
Vue 2.4.4

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/5zyw568ojk](https://codesandbox.io/s/5zyw568ojk)

### Steps to reproduce
1. create route
2. add in component property, arrow func with object
```
() => ({
      component: import('./components/Calendar/Calendar.vue'),
      loading: PageLoader,
    })
```
3. change network speed in devtools

### What is expected?
I expect to see my component loader while the async component is loading

### What is actually happening?
The loading component is not shown and the route is not changed until the async component loads.


### Comments
https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components.html#Advanced-Async-Components
<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support for inheriting attrs in router-link tag" (#1678) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
router-link can render a specified tag which could happen to be a component. This component could have its own props but currently there is no way to pass them down. Eg.

```
// the primary prop will not be passed down to my-button
<router-link tag="my-button" primary></router-link>
```

Unless I am missing something I would like to request a way to solve this situation.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "hashchange event not working in 2.8 " (#1807) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.8.0 & 3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/9r6xhqbp/41/](http://jsfiddle.net/9r6xhqbp/41/)

### Steps to reproduce
Switch between `/home` and `/foo`

### What is expected?
`hashchange` triggers and you'll see `1`s printed in the console.

### What is actually happening?
Nothing is printed.

---
`hashchange` works fine in 2.7.0: http://jsfiddle.net/9r6xhqbp/40/

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Url params in child route undefined" (#1809) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.8.0 & 3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/xfmcLgjd/4/](http://jsfiddle.net/xfmcLgjd/4/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Create route with optional param
2. Create in route, child route with optional param


### What is expected?
```js
id === 10  
mode === 'test'  
modeId === 1  
```

### What is actually happening?
```js
id === 10
mode === undefined
modeId === undefined

```
---
With problem only from 2.8.0 and only with child.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Proposal: createLogger can optionally log actions" (#987) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
## Proposal
Allow `createLogger` to optionally log actions, added a couple of options
```js
{
  actionFilter,
  actionTransformer,
  logActions,
  logMutations
}
```

With some sane default to keep current functionality by default, this would be an opt-in option.

When enabled you get something like:
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2752665/30676356-4db7bc52-9e4b-11e7-847c-99c189f1c270.png)

It just logs the action type and payload, since we cant tie actions to mutations, which I think its ok.

PS: I'm about to do a small plugin in case this proposal doesn't get approved and will update this PR with the url just in case someone is looking for this functionality. It would be awesome if we could have it built-in tho.

Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/derevandal/pen/PJBgaQ](https://codepen.io/derevandal/pen/PJBgaQ)

### Steps to reproduce
Just write in search field to attempt to filter courses' list

### What is expected?
Filter courses' name, slug and kind by input

### What is actually happening?
When u type in search field, this input only save one digit
